title: Today’s entertainment picks:
text:
Published: Fri, October 2, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
Today’s entertainment picks: 
v Phantoms hockey, 7:05 p.m.: It’s $1 beer night at Covelli Centre as the local hockey squad takes on the Bloomington Thunder; 330-747-7825. 
v “The Miracle Worker,” 8 p.m.: The amazing and true story of Annie Sullivan and Helen Keller, presented by Crown Theater ($15) at Main Street Theater, 5 N. Main St., Columbiana; brownpapertickets.com. 
v “My Big Fat Gay Wedding,” 8 p.m.: This original production of Rust Belt Theater ($15) is a musical spoof of weddings, both straight and gay. It’s at Calvin Center, 755 Mahoning Ave., Youngstown; 330-507-2358. 
v “Incorruptible,” 8 p.m.: A comedy from the dark ages ($13) at New Castle Playhouse, 212 E. Long Ave., New Castle, Pa.; 724-654-3437. 
v Blood Moon Farms, 7 p.m. to midnight: Seasonal Halloween attraction opens at the Canfield Fairgrounds. Go to bloodmoonfarm.com for info. 
“Dr. Ken” (8:30 p.m., ABC): Ken Jeong (“Community”) headlines the new sitcom “Dr. Ken.” He plays a blunt physician with a horrible bedside manner. His mouth also gets him into trouble at home. 
“Ancient Aliens” (9 p.m., History): Hey, get off their lawns! 
“Love at First Swipe” (9 p.m., TLC): Online daters get help with their profiles in this new reality series. Tonight, a woman’s “weirdrobe” is updated. 
TV listings, B6 
Three Dog Night show postponed 
YOUNGSTOWN 
The Oct. 11 concert by Three Dog Night at Stambaugh Auditorium has been postponed due to a band member’s health problems. A rescheduled Stambaugh date will be announced soon. 
Those who have purchased tickets should hold on to them, as they will be honored on the rescheduled date. For information, call the Stambaugh box office at 330-259-0555. 
Minority business mixer at theater 
YOUNGSTOWN 
In conjunction with its upcoming production of “The Colored Museum,” The Youngstown Playhouse will present a Minority Business Mixer on Oct. 15 from 5 to 7 p.m. in the meeting space off the main lobby. 
The event is open to the public. Participants will be charged a $30 fee for a “business table” and one ticket to the Oct. 15 performance of the play. There will be wine and light refreshments and samples from local caterers. Additional tickets to the Oct. 15 production can be purchased for $20 apiece. To register, call the Playhouse at 330-788-8739. Space is limited to the first 60 businesses that respond by Monday. 
Basket auction at Saxon Club 
AUSTINTOWN 
The Saxon Club, 710 S. Meridian Road, is sponsoring its 25th annual basket auction Sunday to benefit its scholarship fund for Youngstown State University students. 
Doors open for bidding at noon, and the auction will begin at 2 p.m. in the club’s ballroom. Auctioneer will be Casey Malone. 
Admission is $5, which includes a door-prize entry, hot dog, chips, coffee, pop or water and 25 auction bidding tickets. Other stories of interest
